Until this year, I’d never really thought a lot about my little sister Lily besides grudgingly helping Mom when Lily inevitably took ill (or went and hurt herself). With five years on her, she was always just the pipsqueak little sibling who was more of an annoyance than anything. She was always trying to follow me around, and we often fought about stupid things like doing chores. Lily often won with Mom because she usually was just getting over some bug or other.

Last week she had a cold, and she’d run a fever and spent two days in her bed, while I got stuck with all the chores again. She mostly seemed over it this week, so when she said she felt dizzy after Mom had just left, I decided to follow her into the living room and plop down next to her on the couch. I told her, “Dizzy, huh? Let me feel your forehead.”

As I lay the back of my hand gently against Lily’s forehead, trying to gauge whether she feverish again, she pouted and said, “I’m fine Tommy! My tummy just feels…funny. Mom says I might be Lacktoast Insolvent whatever THAT means.”

“Yeah, but I don’t think being Lactose Intolerant usually leads to dizziness, kiddo”, I frowned and got up; “I better get your thermometer.”

Lily still lay there as I went down the hall for her old rectal thermometer that Mom used on her until as recently last year. Suddenly, Lily bounded up off the couch, and asked, “MY thermometer? What do you mean, Tommy?”

“Oh, YOU know the one, Lily”, as I rummaged around the hall closet, looking for where Mom had likely retired the thermometer. Lily was actually laughing nervously and grabbing my right arm with her tiny hands, saying, “Mom doesn’t use that one anymore. I use the same one you and Mom use now!” in her tiny voice.

“Ahh! There it is!” I grinned, finding the slightly larger rectal thermometer in a box along with a vibrating massager and a rubber enema bottle. I made a mental note of the other items, but was most interested in taking Lily’s temperature at the moment.

info.brief_description: You have a little sister who looks up to you. You can be a nice or mean to her.
info.description:
You are a teenager (boy or girl, you choose in the beginning) with a little sister named Lily, who is around 11 or 12. Lily is small and weak, even for a little girl because she gets hurt and sick all the time, and you, being the older sibling, have to be responsible for taking care of her often. She really looks up to you and sees you as a hero. Your attitude toward Lily varies depending on the story, but you generally see yourself as her vast superior and want her to know this.

You can be mean to Lily, you can be nice to Lily. You can even do dirty things to her if you want. You can be a wholesome loving older sibling and care for your poor frail little sister, you can be a barbarian drenched in sex and violence. As long as you're in charge and Lily submits to you, all is fair.

Things that are encouraged:
Embarrassing Lily
Naked Lily
Dominating Lily
Incest

You can do other stuff if you want, whatever magical crap you like, but the stuff I write will try to be more geared toward those topics.

Quick description of Lily-
Lily is a little girl, rather small and weak for her age because she gets hurt and sick all the time. She is rather skinny and short, since you're a big and tough you can lift and carry her with a little bit of effort. Lily has green eyes, blonde hair (although not naturally, she begged Mom to let her dye it), and a cute smile. She has not really started puberty yet. Her butt is small and bony. Lily loves Pokémon, TV (she will watch literally anything, even infomercials), snack cakes from the gas station, and shiny objects. She is trying to learn how to juggle but is really bad at it. She is the most un-athletic kid you know, she can't run fast or far and can only barely ride her bike. Lily worships the ground you walk on, you are like a hero to her. If you say something is cool, Lily will agree. If you say you hate something, Lily will try to hate it with you.
